task.summary: Default task

currently unable to run viscous fingering code. with coarse mesh, it crashes after 61 iterations even after reverting parameter and aux file back to original version. it has to do with the split? Idk.
testing for why stab_2 doesn't work
I Think I have a lead on both being assembled...
Still the same...
Still the same...
Still the same...

Started running tests with viscous fingering code. Three files added to show performance on different number of processors for different cases. Note that sa_perturbation file is fixed for all cases. Need to specify perturbation file for 3-D.

More tests for viscous fingering. Three .txt files save output from simulation for various cases. Most notably, 3-D case shows output for up to 200 iterations. Took around 4 hours to complete on 32 processors. Also, it's noted that perturbation files will be set as well depending on case.
Still debugging. currently trying to move arguments that change as time loop runs outside of constructor to new function.

found something interesting with the tilde parameter. I tried increasing it and the manufactured solution showed an error that didn't increase as the mesh refined. It didn't have a good order of convergence, but it's something to investigate
successfully moved stuff out of pl constructor to separate update function to accurately capture update. moves stuff out of constructor. pl converges and doesn't conflict with anything else.
successfully moved stuff out of pl constructor to separate update function to accurately capture update. This time with Sa. going to continue to clean things up to look more presentable to Mathias

cleaned up conditionals to make it more readable. but in summary:
1.)pl and sa constructors are only called once before the loop
2.) dynamic variables have been given their own update function to be called at every time step. These were previously in the constructor but have been moved into their own function for clarity.
3.) conditional statements were modified to now include change between stab method and previous non stab method. three conditions are there: i.) first it and stab
first it changed to false in this statement
ii.) stab only rhs is recomputed
iii.) non stab
both mat and rhs are recomputed

A few things are certain:
we know for a fact that the matrix is not reassembled at each time step. This is verified in the output mat first and second it files.
what follows then is that the rhs function implementation doesn't modify the matrix.
Want to double check sa formulation with loic.

Still not completely working. the biggest thing to debug is that even when matrix and rhs are being computed at every time step the method isn't converging the best with first order. when compressible, and ktilde_a is 3, we get subpar results with order 1 convergence but still need to be better since other stab_2 results are better.
checking to see if results are different.
made directories to reduce project down to branch.
made directories to reduce project down to branch.
still making stab_2 branches
currently not working, but need to check on stab_2 implementation

created new branch because stab_debug was too experimental. stab_3 now calls only the constructors once before the time loop. EVERYTHING WORKS. matrix is still being recomputed at every time step. Will create new stab_3_debug to work on this.

still not converging. Want to double check formulation of rhs.
cleaned up implementation of computing rhs. We don't need setup rhs function. we just need to set it up as the matrix in the setup_system function.
we just set rhs vec =0 each time assemble_rhs is called.
still not converging. still stuff to debug
cleaned up aux file to have more consistent naming for stability terms
cleaned up aux file to have more consistent naming for stability terms. did this for q5s and visc fing
cleaned up sv file to not contain k steps. still had them for some reason... working commit

cleaned up files as best I can:
parameters.prm file has stab_t removed since that's a feature we will not be including anymore. removed this on all tests
pl_problem.hh removed update_pl function. decided that update should occur when assemble mat is called. moved all variables inside assemble mat function to take as input.
Sa_problem.hh removed update_sa function. decided, like for pl, that update for values should just be done in the assemble functions.
Sv_problem.hh edited constructor to only be called once before loop. added arguments to assemble function to update dynamic variables.
ThreePhase.cc contains all reflected changes in header files. so all public member functions should contain correct arguments when called in .cc file.
Everything is working correctly. still same results.

cleaned up Sa_problem.hh more by eliminating arguments for solve function. no longer storing matrix. still works same as before
also removed setup_rhs function as there is no need if initialization is done in the assemble_mat. in actuality, assmelbe_mat has been renamed to assemble system.
cleaned up stuff more for Sa. got rid of comments to shorted size of file.

removed all branches except main branch. Hoping to have this be a good way forward.
also removed midpoint files for now.

removed all branches except main branch. Hoping to have this be a good way forward.
also removed midpoint files for now.
copied from cappanera's changes for Sa and ThreePhase.cc.

moved setup_system as a public member function to be called in ThreePhase.cc. Working currently with matrix and rhs being recomputed at every time step.
still need to debug matrix being recomputed at every time step.
edited CMakeLists.txt to suppress warnings. working

moved setup system function for pl and sa outside of assemble function.
setup system for pl and sa is only called once.
still debugging for matrix being reassembled at every time step.

cleaned up ThreePhase.cc to not include functions and #include statements that are irrelevant to the project
cleaned up pl_problem.hh to not include functions and #include statements that are irrelevant to the project
Ran a bunch of tests to see if we get convergence based on value of katilde. Will continue to test

confirmed that stab method for Sv results in time independent stiffness matrix. when stab is true for sv, matrix is only assembled once at the beginning. currently running tests to see if convergence is obtained.

Changed the way the q5s mesh is generated. It involves mergining 2 L shaped domains instead of merging 3 different rectangles. Advantage is one less triangulation is needed and is compatible with 3-D. Going to verify that problem can be solved on new mesh, but should be the same.
Need to do: 1.) run test on 2-D domain with correct stab method for Sa 2.) Need to think about boundary conditions for 3-D and solving problem with Loic's suggestion.
Needed to include Aux function from q5s in push....

What we know: 1.) both matricies are staying same when stab_i is true, i=a,v
2.) both need to have gamma_Sv_e += sqrt(totalDarcyVelo_extrapolation*totalDarcyVelo_extrapolation); to have convergence. if either one has this included, the error doesn't converge at all
3.) there is still a possible bug because we don't get optimal convergence when running tests and q5s is not running properly.

cleaned up files as best I can:
parameters.prm file has stab_t removed since that's a feature we will not be including anymore. removed this on all tests
pl_problem.hh removed update_pl function. decided that update should occur when assemble mat is called. moved all variables inside assemble mat function to take as input.
Sa_problem.hh removed update_sa function. decided, like for pl, that update for values should just be done in the assemble functions.
Sv_problem.hh edited constructor to only be called once before loop. added arguments to assemble function to update dynamic variables.
ThreePhase.cc contains all reflected changes in header files. so all public member functions should contain correct arguments when called in .cc file.

confirmed that stab method for Sv results in time independent stiffness matrix. when stab is true for sv, matrix is only assembled once at the beginning. currently running tests to see if convergence is obtained.

Changed the way the q5s mesh is generated. It involves mergining 2 L shaped domains instead of merging 3 different rectangles. Advantage is one less triangulation is needed and is compatible with 3-D. Going to verify that problem can be solved on new mesh, but should be the same.
Need to do: 1.) run test on 2-D domain with correct stab method for Sa 2.) Need to think about boundary conditions for 3-D and solving problem with Loic's suggestion.
Needed to include Aux function from q5s in push....

What we know: 1.) both matricies are staying same when stab_i is true, i=a,v
2.) both need to have gamma_Sv_e += sqrt(totalDarcyVelo_extrapolation*totalDarcyVelo_extrapolation); to have convergence. if either one has this included, the error doesn't converge at all
3.) there is still a possible bug because we don't get optimal convergence when running tests and q5s is not running properly.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
What we know: 1.) both matricies are staying same when stab_i is true, i=a,v
2.) both need to have gamma_Sv_e += sqrt(totalDarcyVelo_extrapolation*totalDarcyVelo_extrapolation); to have convergence. if either one has this included, the error doesn't converge at all
3.) there is still a possible bug because we don't get optimal convergence when running tests and q5s is not running properly.
